intro: Helianthemum calycinum, commonly known as the rock rose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces showy, bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are small, fleshy, and gray-green in color, adapted to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils. Helianthemum calycinum is often found in coastal areas and is well-suited to dry, sunny environments.
